title: Ticket #2604: how should startd handle failure of condor_startd -classad
description:
We had an incident in GLOW where 15 machines were sitting around without HasFileTransfer=true. We do not know why, because they were in this state for 23 days, and the logs don't go back that far. A reconfig caused them to return to normal.

On startup when the startd queries the capabilities of the starter with condor_starter -classad, should it EXCEPT if the vanilla starter does not initialize correctly?

Or should we phase out HasFileTransfer?
